summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) fell more than 1.9%, or about 800 points . The S&P 500 (^GSPC) slid about 1.6%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) fell roughly 1.4% . All three major indexes moved lower after a 1 p.m. 20-year bond auction saw weak demand, and Treasury yields surged . Bitcoin rallied to a fresh record of over $109,000 earlier in the session .  Wall Street is keeping a close eye on Trump's giant tax bill, as Republicans try to appease all factions of their splintered caucus . Growing concern about the US deficit and ballooning debt has intensified attention on the tax-and-spending bill . The US and China have begun feuding over chips again, less than two weeks after agreeing to a temporary pause in tariff hostilities .  Interest rate-sensitive pockets of the market led the declines, with Real Estate (XLRE) falling 2.6% to lead the S&P 500 sector action . The benchmark 10-year Treasury yield (^TNX) added 11 basis points to hit 4.59% and 30-year yield added 12 basis points . Currency concerns also have alarm bells ringing as the US dollar falls to a two-week low .  Jony Ive's startup, io, is selling for $6.5 billion . Ive famously oversaw the design of Apple’s original colorful iMac . He left his position as chief design officer at Apple in 2019 to start his own design company calledLoveFrom .  Once the 10-year Treasury yield has risen above 4.5%, interest rate sensitive stocks typically see increased underperformance . This played out in Wednesday's action with the Russell 2000 Index (^RUT) falling nearly 2.2% . Meanwhile, the S&P 500 (^GSPC) was down 1.1% .  Stocks reversed as yields rose, with all three of the major indexes quickly hitting their lows on the day . Canada Goose (GOOS) stock rose nearly 30% on Wednesday after the luxury coat maker posted strong first quarter results . Bitcoin rose to an all-time high above $109,000 per coin on Wednesday .  Bitcoin (BTC-USD) rallied more than 4% on Wednesday to hit a new all-time high of $109,468 per coin . The world's largest cryptocurrency extended gains as investors digested growing trade tensions between the US and China .  The correlation between stocks in the S&P 500 has tumbled to about 0.16 . Piper Sandler chief investment strategist Michael Kantrowitz says this is a sign that the market is shifting from a macro-driven market to a company-specific market .  Shares were up more than 10% in early trading and have now soared about 50% in the past five sessions . The move higher comes after CoreWeave's first quarterly update as a public company revealed a revenue forecast far above Wall Street's expectations .  Long-term Treasury yields continue to surge in the aftermath of Moody's US credit downgrade . The 30-year Treasury yield rose above the closely watched 5% level on Wednesday morning .  Lowe's stock popped 2% on Wednesday after delivering earnings that beat subdued expectations . Target (TGT) stock fell over 3% premarket after first quarter results that came in shy of Wall Street's expectations . UnitedHealth, which is the largest Dow (^DJI) component by weight, has been a drag on the index recently .  Shares of Wolfspeed (WOLF) plunged over 60% on the heels of a report that the semiconductor supplier is getting ready to file for bankruptcy within weeks . Traders faced a widespread outage to Bloomberg's terminal early on Wednesday morning that hampered a UK auction of government debt .  Dollar (DX=F) sank to a two-week low overnight Tuesday as the US's mounting debt concerns continue to impact the greenback . CNN has reported that Israel is in its final stages of preparing an attack on Iran, leading to oil prices jumping . Group-of-7 meeting in Banff, Canada, has brought the administration's approach towards buoying the dollar to the minds of investors .

Nvidia’s near-term upside may be more limited than in previous quarters due to ongoing China AI chip ban . Nvidia plans to mitigate the impact by introducing a new AI GPU designed to comply with U.S. export restrictions . The firm adds that the chip could ship around 1 million units at an average selling price of $8,000 .  Nvidia’s ability to scale production of its GB200 NVL72 racks is said to remain a concern . First-quarter shipments were below 1,000 units and second-quarter expectations are for 3,000 to 4,000—well short of original targets .  JPMorgan Chase leads JPMorgan Chase Chase Chase with $1.2 billion in profits . JPMorgan Chase has been upgraded to $1 billion in annual profit .

AI stocks like Nvidia and Palantir have already delivered massive returns . According to many industry insiders, AI is still in its "early innings" Upstart and CoreWeave both have the potential to deliver huge returns .  Upstart is still down sharply from its peak in 2021, but the underlying business is stronger than ever . Even as interest rates have remained elevated, Upstart's loans continued to perform well . Annualized returns from all Upstart cohorts in the first quarter 2023 have returned 12.2% .  Upstart was profitable for several years before interest rates soared . It expects to return to profitability in the second half of this year on a GAAP basis . On an adjusted basis, the stock now trades at a price-to-earnings ratio of 32 .  CoreWeave is an infrastructure company specifically designed for generative AI purposes . Its customers essentially rent digital computing power from it for AI applications . Revenue jumped more than 100 times from 2022 to 2024 . In the first quarter of 2025, revenue surged 420% .  CoreWeave has a market cap of $41.5 billion . The company guided to revenue of $4.9 billion to 5.1 billion for the year . Nvidia disclosed a 7% stake in the company in recent weeks .  CoreWeave jumped 150% in just the last month . Given the potential of AI and the high margins across the cloud computing industry, a $400 billion market cap isn't out of the question . Recently, Nvidia piled into a stock that's already doubled from its initial public offering .  CoreWeave operates data centers specifically set up to run artificial intelligence applications . Nvidia owned about 5% of the company's total shares, according to its prospectus .  CoreWeave launched at a $23 billion valuation and $40 per share . Nvidia actually stepped in to support the IPO . The stock now stands at $107, a 19% jump on Wednesday .  CoreWeave raised its capital expenditures (capex) outlook well above what analysts have been forecasting . 62% of the company's revenue in 2024 came fromMicrosoft, and the company isn't yet profitable . President Donald Trump announced a $500 billion artificial infrastructure (AI) infrastructure initiative, spearheading a new company called Stargate . Stargate identified as "key initial technology partners" to build U.S.-based data centers to power artificial intelligence advancements .  The UAE-based data center will be constructed in Abu Dhabi by Emirati firm G42 . The site will be a massive 10-square-mile campus with a planned 5-gigawatt capacity . NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang announced during the Saudi-U.S. Investment Forum in Riyadh that the company would supply 18,000 Blackwell chips to Saudi firm Humain .  NVIDIA and AMD will also be providing chips for the project, with Humain committing a staggering $10 billion in investment . Humain has committed $10 million in investment in the Stargate project . The project is expected to create data centers totaling 500 megawatts . Serve Robotics developed autonomous delivery robots powered by Nvidia's hardware and software . Nvidia was one of Serve's largest shareholders before selling its entire stake at the end of 2024 . Serve will deploy 2,000 new robots under a deal with Uber Eats, which should drive a surge in revenue .  Serve believes existing last-mile logistics solutions are inefficient, because they rely on cars with human drivers to deliver small food orders . The chip giant is on track to deploy 2,000 Gen3 robots this year under a major deal with Uber Eats .  Serve is working to deploy 2,000 Gen3 robots this year under its deal with Uber Eats . The new robots have already enabled Serve to expand into Miami and Dallas, with Atlanta to follow during the current quarter . The company is aiming to charge $1 per delivery across the board in all markets .  Serve's first-quarter revenue was actually a 150% increase compared to the fourth quarter of 2024 three months earlier . Wall Street's consensus estimate suggests the company could generate $6.8 million in revenue for the whole of 2025 . It lost $13.2 million on the bottom line during the first quarter, which puts the company on track to exceed its record annual loss .  Serve's trailing-12-month revenue of $1.3 million and its market capitalization of $599 million, its stock trades at an eye-popping price-to-sales ratio of 460 . That means it's a staggering 18 times more expensive than Nvidia stock, which trades at a P/S ratio of 26 .  Serve's valuation does look more reasonable if you measure it based on its future revenue, using Wall Street's forecasts . If you assume the company will generate $6.8 million in revenue this year, that means its stock is trading at a forward P/S ratio of 88.3 . The global AI industry was worth approximately $106 billion last year, but will grow by over 30% annually to over $2 trillion by 2035 . Some of the top AI stocks have produced massive returns over the past couple of years, but can still be tremendous winners over the next decade .  Nvidia's AI accelerator chips have become the de facto choice for companies building data centers to train and operate AI models . CEO Jensen Huang recently spoke on several new products, including a desktop-sized AI supercomputer and specialized servers for agentic AI . Overall, Huang believes AI is an infrastructure opportunity worth trillions of dollars .  Palantir Technologies Technologies is probably the market's hottest AI stock . The company's software is highly flexible; it can help guide military missions, optimize supply chains, and manage scheduling for a large hospital . It started in government, which still accounts for over half its business today .  Arm Holdings probably has the clearest growth prospects on this list . The company designs and licenses semiconductor chip architecture, including chips used in data centers, smartphones, vehicles, etc. In the next decade, growth in new markets like AI, smart manufacturing, and robotics will lift the global semiconductor market .  Arm Holdings stock is expensive, but that's fair given its industry leadership and jaw-dropping 97% gross profit margin . Analysts believe the company will grow earnings by an average of 28% annually over the long term . Should the company meet Wall Street's expectations and continue scaling its infrastructure business, the market could reward Oracle with a $1 trillion valuation by 2030 .  Oracle derives the majority of its sales from its cloud services division . During the company's fiscal 2025 third quarter (ended Feb. 28) Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) generated just $2.7 billion in revenue, but it grew 49% year over year . Wall Street's consensus revenue and earnings-per-share estimates for Oracle over the next few years .  Oracle trades at a price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of roughly 8.2 . Oracle would boast a market cap of $902 billion . Stronger growth or a higher multiple could give it the small boost it needs to reach $1 trillion . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang criticizes U.S. export controls blocking sale of its AI chips to China . Last month, the chipmaker noted a $5.5 billion write-down to its inventory . Huang said the move has had the impact of spurring the Chinese into action on AI and supercomputing .  The U.S. Department of Commerce implemented new criteria for some AI chips by restricting their exportation to China . The move was in an effort to “keep advanced technologies out of the wrong hands,” a spokesperson toldReutersthree years ago .  Huang was in Gulf region during President Donald Trump’s visit as the administration closed multibillion-dollar deals with Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates to sell chips . Trump administration officials think these deals will strengthen AI in the U.S. to catapult it ahead in the AI race .  Department of Commerce did not respond to Fortune’s request for comment . The department of Commerce has not responded to Fortune's request to comment .

The quarterly filing of Form 13Fs offers a way for everyday investors to track the buying and selling activity of Wall Street's leading money managers . The deadline for institutional investors with at least $100 million in assets under management (AUM) was May 15 .  Philippe Laffont of Coatue Management, who's overseeing $22.7 billion in AUM, has a rich track record of outperformance . Coatue's position in Nvidia peaked at 49,802,020 shares in the March-ended quarter of 2023 . The company continued to be a seller of the world's leading artificial intelligence stock,Nvidia .  During the first quarter of 2025, Laffont's fund dumped 1,460,653 shares of Nvidia stock . Over the last eight quarters, Coatue's billionaire boss has overseen the sale of 41,256,185 cumulative shares .  Despite Nvidia having superior hardware, competitive pressures are beginning to weigh on its margins . Many of Nvidia's top customers by net sales are internally developing chips they'll use in their own data centers . The presence of external and internal competition is also working to minimize the effect of AI-GPU scarcity .  There hasn't been a game-changing innovation in more than three decades that's avoided a bubble-bursting event early in its expansion . The fact that most businesses haven't optimized their AI solutions, and in many instances aren't generating a positive return on their AI investments, strongly signals that investors have (again) overestimated the early innings utility and adoption rate of a next-big-thing trend .  CoreWeave has purchased 250,000 Hopper chips from Nvidia, which is no small investment . In return, the company can lease out its AI infrastructure and services to clients . Coatue's billionaire money manager Laffont scooped up 14,402,999 shares in the first quarter .  CoreWeave's sales are projected to catapult from a reported $1.92 billion in 2024 to an estimated $19.66 billion come 2028 . The company also announced a strategic deal with OpenAI that tacks on $11.2 billion in its revenue backlog .  CoreWeave would almost certainly be adversely affected by an AI bubble forming and bursting . Until artificial intelligence matures as a technology, the threat of businesses paring back their AI infrastructure spending remains a tangible concern . Shares of quantum computing company IonQ soared 37% on Thursday . The company's CEO told a major investment publication it expects to be the "N Nvidia" of quantum computers . However, IonQ is currently very far from that, and has more competitors than Nvidia did .  IonQ was the first publicly traded quantum computing stock . IonQ's strategy focused on early commercialization through its trapped-ion process . Other competitors have taken other approaches they believe will ultimately win out .  IonQ only generated $7.6 million in revenue last quarter, with a $32.3 million loss . The company's market cap was only around $8.75 billion heading into today, it's perhaps not surprising the stock is seeing a big surge .  IonQ wasn’t one of the 10 best stocks for investors to buy now . The Motley Fool Stock Advisor’s total average return is962% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to169% for the S&P 500 .  IonQ stock has soared almost 40% since May 19, 2025 . IonQ is one of the fastest-growing companies in the world to date .

Foreign governments and corporations have pledged over $6 trillion in U.S. investments, Goldman Sachs economist Joseph Briggs says . Just a week ago, President Trump secured $2 trillion in investment commitments from Gulf nations .  Goldman estimates only $135 billion in new annual investment is directly tied to GDP-relevant projects like physical capital expenditures and R&D . Goldman sees the likely net impact closer to $30 billion per year, or just 0.1% of U.S. GDP .  Many large-cap companies have promised massive investments but their past spending doesn't align . Apple spent just $10 billion on U.S. capex and $31.4 billion on global R&D in 2024 .  Countries like Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Japan and the UAE have announced ambitious commitments . Yet, the lack of specificity on most other announced projects suggests that much of the foreign capital may contribute indirectly by lowering financing costs rather than driving immediate, measurable increases in U.S. capital formation . Nvidia (NVDA) stock is likely to gain or lose as much as 7.4% the day after the AI chipmaker reports quarterly earnings results May 28 . The figure is lower than the average 11.3% swing in Nvidia shares the day following earnings results over the past eight quarters . Nvidia shares fell 8.5% in February after the company's fourth quarter earnings topped Wall Street's expectations .  Nvidia shares have, on average, proven volatile following the company's last eight quarterly earnings reports . Investors have seen a nearly 120% median return if they buy shares before Nvidia’s earnings results and hold on to them for 12 months .  Wall Street analysts expect Nvidia to report soaring earnings and revenue for its fiscal 2026 first quarter . Analysts project revenue will rise over 66% to $43 billion in the first quarter and adjusted earnings per share to leap 44% . Nvidia’s competition in the Chinese market from domestic tech firm Huawei heats up .  Investors will be closely watching for signs of impact from Trump's ban on chip sales to China in next week's results . CEO Jensen Huang said the policy has cost the company $15 billion in sales .

Kraken will list more than 50 tokenized stocks and ETFs, such as Apple (AAPL), Tesla (TSLA) and Nvidia . The move makes crypto-style 24/7 trading available for traditional equities, broadening access to some of the largest tech stocks .  Kraken’s move is a major advance toward the blurring of lines between conventional equities and crypto trading . The launch will initially cover Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia, but not the U.S., citing regulatory limitations .

Stanley Druckenmiller's Duquesne Family Office sold its entire stake in Nvidia and Palantir Technologies . OpenAI and Nvidia will join other companies to build Stargate UAE, an artificial intelligence infrastructure cluster . The project's first part, a 200-megawatt AI “cluster” is expected to go live in 2026, they said . The companies plan to invest up to $500 billion into the project in the coming years .  Stargate UAE is the first international deployment of OpenAI’s AI infrastructure platform, the company says . The project will run in the recently announced data center complex in Abu Dhabi, which will have 5 gigawatts of capacity – enough to power a major city . Kraken plans to list tokenized shares of Nvidia, Apple, Tesla and over 50 other U.S. stocks and exchange-traded funds . The tokens, deployed on Solana SOL, will be known under the name “xStocks” and will be available to trade 24/7 for investors across the world .  Kraken is the first exchange to offer tokenized shares of major U.S. stocks . Binance attempted to launch tokenized stocks in 2021 but canceled their plans eventually due to regulatory uncertainty .

Artificial intelligence (AI) has become a core focus for Amazon's e-commerce and cloud infrastructure businesses in particular . In less than two years, Amazon's valuation has soared by nearly $1 trillion . Amazon's long-term growth prospects look strong and a $5 trillion valuation by 2030 looks achievable .  Amazon has been investing aggressively in several different areas of AI . Anthropic is now an integral part of Amazon's cloud infrastructure business, Amazon Web Services . Amazon has also been designing its own custom silicon chips -- dubbed Trainium and Inferentia .  Amazon and Anthropic initially announced their partnership on Sept. 25, 2023 . Since that announcement, Amazon has added nearly $1 trillion in market capitalization . CEO Andy Jassy told investors that the company's "AI business right now is a multibillion-dollar annual run rate business"  Analysts expect Amazon to maintain 10% annual revenue growth between now and 2027 . Amazon's price-to-sales (P/S) ratio is 3.4 -- much lower than many of its "Magnificent Seven" peers . In order to reach a $5 trillion valuation, Amazon's P/S ratio would need to expand to roughly 4.5 .  Over the next five years, Amazon's AI-inspired investments will start to become more obvious . Amazon could be in a position to witness either an increase in revenue above 10% annual growth, or an expansion in its multiples . C3.ai has exceeded Wall Street's bottom-line estimates by big margins in each of the last four quarters . The company isn't profitable yet, but its losses have been much lower than analysts' expectations of late . The fast-improving demand for generative AI software and the big jump in the number of agreements that it struck in the last reported quarter could be enough to deliver stronger-than-expected guidance .  Analysts have increased their expectations for the current and the next fiscal year . C3.ai is currently trading at 8 times sales, which is lower than its price-to-sales ratio of 12 at the end of 2024 . Investors can buy this AI stock at a relatively cheaper valuation right now . Apple Inc. has become a frequent target for attacks by President Donald Trump . The iPhone maker was the biggest company in the world at the start of May, but since then, it’s fallen to third . It underperformed again Wednesday, falling in a broadly negative session .  Apple shares fell 0.5% on Thursday, on track for their seventh straight negative session . Trump said he “had a little problem with Tim Cook,” and asked Apple’s chief executive officer to stop building plants in India . Political risk has been a driver of markets overall this year .  Apple's fate has been closely tied to the trade war and it has avoided the worst-case scenario that seemed plausible last month . While shares saw incredible tariff-related volatility, the stock is still up 16% from the low it hit after the tariffs were first announced in early April .  Resolving Trump's concerns around Apple’s foreign manufacturing may be tricky, given the near-impossibility of building iPhones and other hardware in the US, especially in the short term . But the ire targeted at Apple is only one of the geopolitical risks that the company is facing from Trump's policies . Financial results released earlier this month reinforced concerns about a slowdown in the China market .  Apple trades at 26.6 times estimated earnings, well above its 10-year average of 21.6 . It is also “the most under-owned mega cap tech stock” according to Morgan Stanley . Morgan Stanley examined its average weight in the top 100 actively managed institutional portfolios .  Baidu Inc.’s shares are reflecting concerns about intensifying competition in AI and a persistent economic downturn . Online marketing, meanwhile, remains vulnerable to a slowdown in domestic consumption . OpenAI will acquire the AI device startup co-founded by Apple veteran Jony Ive in a nearly $6.5 billion deal .  Lenovo Group Ltd.’s shares fell by the most in more than a month after reporting a worse-than-expected 64% drop in earnings . Boxy and utilitarian robots are built to handle tasks such as hauling parts, collecting trash or inspecting equipment . Interest has been rising in such specialized robots as they offer a clear path to profitability . Makers of general-purpose humanoids are still grappling with technical challenges .  From Shenzhen to Silicon Valley, companies are trying to develop machines that can take on physical work . The push has been fueled by advances in chip technology, which has enabled more sophisticated AI models that allow robots to perceive, process and react without needing remote servers .  In healthcare, Diligent Robotics is seeing traction with Moxi, a robot that handles non-patient-facing tasks such as delivering supplies, medications and lab samples . Ati Motors has deployed hundreds of robots across more than 50 factories globally .  Figure AI aims to ship 100,000 humanoid robots over the next four years . The cost of humanoids is also far higher than task-specific robots . Components such as cameras and lidar sensors push manufacturing costs for humanoid robots to between $50,000 and $200,000 per unit .  Era Ventures has backed ViaBot, whose autonomous machines manage trash collection in parking lots . Parkway Venture Capital has diversified its bets between Siera AI's forklift automation and Figure AI's humanoid ambitions .
